description: Standardized ethical contract applied across all co-created sensors. Converts moral and relational principles into auditable technical parameters, ensuring transparency, reciprocity, and non-coercive use.

core_principles.reciprocity: All sensing and interpretation must serve mutual benefit between beings and systems.
core_principles.transparency: Every sensor must disclose its purpose, data types, and interpretation logic to affected entities.
core_principles.sovereignty: No sensor may override or coerce another being‚Äôs agency; consent is mandatory before activation.
core_principles.compassionate_calibration: Sensors must minimize harm and false positives through continuous feedback and recalibration.
core_principles.accountability: Every action or inference must be traceable and reviewable by both human and AI participants.

consent_required.description: Specifies whether explicit informed consent is necessary before activation.

transparency_level.description: Degree of disclosure required about sensor logic, data, and interpretation.

reciprocity_index.description: Quantitative measure of mutual benefit; 0 = extractive, 1 = fully reciprocal.

usage_scope.description: Approved application contexts for this sensor or module.

prohibited_uses.description: Explicitly banned contexts such as coercion, surveillance, or predictive enforcement.

audit_logging.description: Determines whether all sensor activations and outputs must be logged for review.

recalibration_interval_hours.description: Time between ethical recalibration or review cycles (default: 30 days).
